column1: #Text=This repository contain examples of how to use the NELA-GT-2019 data set with Python 3.
#Text=__For more details about this dataset, check the paper__:
#Text=If you use this dataset in your work, please cite us as follows:
#Text=    title={NELA-GT-2019: A Large Multi-Labelled News Dataset for The Study of Misinformation in News Articles},
#Text=Each data point collected corresponds to an article and contains the fields described below.
#Text=`author` | string | author who signed the article
#Text=`published` | string | date time string as provided by source
#Text=`collection_utc` | integer | unix timestamp of collection date
#Text=We provide aggregated labels based on Media Bias/Fact Check reports, classifying each source as:
#Text=__Note__: the labels used in this aggregation were collected from Media Bias/Fact Check on Mar 20, 2020.
#Text=* How to load the data from the Sqlite3 database using SQL queries
#Text=+ Loading data from single or multiple sources from the database
#Text=  + Loading data from the database into a Pandas dataframe
#Text=* How to load NELA in JSON format with Python 3
#Text=  + Loading a directory of NELA JSON files - **WARNING**: this consumes a lot of memory
